comment._content: en.wikipedia.org/wiki/John_F._O'Ryan See also

comment.author: 23103743@N05
comment._content: From www.rootsweb.ancestry.com/~nybroome/academy/grad73.htm "CHARLES H. HITCHCOCK 4 Jay Street, Binghamton, New York Graduate Hamilton College A. B. 1897. Admitted to Bar, Albany, 1884, February. Served in National Guard New York, from May 30, 1882. Spanish-American War, Captain Company H, 105 New York Volunteer Infantry, 1898-9. World War, Captain United States Army, June 1918 – February 1919. Colonel 1st Infantry National Guards New York 1905-1916. Brevet Brigadier General June 1910. Now Colonel Infantry, Retired List. Commissioner of Public Health of Binghamton, 1908-1909. Now a member of Law Firm of Jenkins, Deyo & Hitchcock, Binghamton."

comment.author: 52460663@N04
comment._content:
Lol
In 1940 Maj. Gen. O'Ryan, according to the Washington Post of July 16, 1940, was registered with the State Department as an agent of the Japanese government.
